newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Cimpor jumps then recedes after result.
newsitem.headline: Cimpor jumps then recedes after result.

text.p: Shares in Portuguese cement producer Cimpor-Cimentos de Portugal jumped after the release of its 13.7 percent increase in first half consolidated net profits and then fell back as dealers took profits, dealers said.
"At the first glance, the results are good and the stock felt demand pressure," one dealer said.
Cimpor shares jumped 12 escudos to 3,390, dealers took profits and by 1415 GMT the share had dropped six escudos from Thursday's close to 3,372.
Dealers said Cimpor's first half consolidated net profit of 11.6 billion escudos, up from 10.2 billion in the same year-ago period, was better than expected.

Cimpor said full-year 1996 profits should rise strongly as it expected to take profits from the sale of its 11.06 percent stake in Banco de Fomento e Exterior, which is being privatised, and its recent purchase of Moroccan cement producer Asment Temara.
